Installing and Loading the R packages

-   Packages are similar for take-home ex 2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, sfdep, tmap, tidyverse)
```
:::


import the hunan and hunan 2012 data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the code"}
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                 layer = "Hunan")
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the code"}
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
```
:::


Combine using left join

-   choose 7 and 15 cos we need the gdp


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_GDPPC <- left_join(hunan, hunan2012) %>%
  select(1:4, 7, 15)
```
:::


Plotting the Chorepleth map


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
tm_shape(hunan_GDPPC) +
  tm_fill("GDPPC",
          style = "quantile",
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "GDPPC") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of GDP per capita by county, Hunan Province",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45,
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  # tm_compass(type = "Bstar", size = 2) +  # Comment or remove this line
  tm_scale_bar() +
  tm_grid(alpha = 0.2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Deriving contiguity weights: Queen's method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm_q <- hunan_GDPPC %>%
  mutate(nb = st_contiguity(geometry),
         wt = st_weights(nb, style = "W"),
         .before = 1)
```
:::


Computing Global Moran' I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
moranI <- global_moran(wm_q$GDPPC,
                       wm_q$nb,
                       wm_q$wt)
glimpse(moranI)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
List of 2
 $ I: num 0.301
 $ K: num 7.64
```
:::
:::


test the moran' I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
global_moran_test(wm_q$GDPPC,
                  wm_q$nb,
                  wm_q$wt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

```
:::
:::


run simulation on Moran I (99 means run 100 times cos it starts with 0)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
global_moran_perm(wm_q$GDPPC,
                  wm_q$nb,
                  wm_q$wt,
                  nsim=99)
```
